subSections.title: Readings
Usage notes
subSections.text:
This is one of only three everyday kanji with a 5 morae reading, and one of only two nouns, namely {{ja-r|詔|みことのり}}. The only other kanji with a 5 morae reading are {{lang|ja|承}}, in the verb {{ja-r|承る|うけたまわる}}, and {{ja-r|志|こころざし}}, and no everyday kanji have a 6 or more morae reading.

The unusually long reading is due to it representing a triple compound word, analyzed as {{ja-r|御%言%宣|み%こと%のり}}, yielding 1+2+2=5.
